title: How to design the ultimate family home – and keep the kids seen but not heard
text:
Family homes must walk a tightrope. Their occupants want space to be together, but there must also be somewhere for individuals to retreat to and get on with their own thing – be that trumpet practice for kids or life admin for parents.

A decade ago, everyone thought that the solution was a big, open-plan kitchen-dining-living space, but they were found ­wanting when it came to privacy. Now, having seen some of the drawbacks of open plan, architects and designers are imagining alternative layouts for family homes where the in-between spaces have become increasingly important.
